column4: for some reason, i can't keep my pc clock synchronized. i choose 'periodically synchronize clock with internet servers,' and have a working server selected, but it doesn't work, and is unchecked every time i go back
it worked fine before i rebooted
can anyone help me with keeping my clock synchronized?
can you file a bug please.  it should do the sync'ing on each boot too
it does, but i want it to keep synchronizing automatically as it should
does it succed, or do you have a firewall in the way?
it succeeds. it just won't 'remember' the setting, and only synchronizes the one time when i hit OK
then it's unchecked when i go back again
it pops up a message saying "Please install NTP"
and then unticks the box because it's not installed
no, ntp is installed. as i said, it worked before reboot
can you file a bug report: https://launchpad.net/distros/ubuntu/+source/gnome-system-tools/+filebug
